properties.title: Sacred Stones Camp
properties.text1: The dog's snarling face, red with a protestor's blood, says a lot about the all-too-human brutality of the Dakota Access Pipeline and the forces that brought it to completion. Yet in many ways, today's struggles against pipelines and fossil-fueld climate change began at Standing Rock in December of 2016.
properties.text2: To begin understanding the experience of this struggle, watch this video. Read the website of the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe. Go much further with the testimony in the #NoDAPL archive.
